}} 'Claude Monet' ( or ; 14 November 18405 December 1926) was a founder of
French impressionist painting, and the most consistent and prolific practitioner
of the movement's philosophy of expressing one's perceptions before nature,
especially as applied to plein-air landscape painting. House, John, et al.:
Monet in the 20th century, page 2, Yale University Press, 1998. The term Impressionism is derived from the title of his
painting [[Impression, Sunrise]] (Impression, soleil levant).
categories: Alumni of the École des Beaux-Arts
